reviews.text: I chose this hotel to stay at with my family after reading TA reviews. The experience was ok. The 1 bed apartment was fine- big enough and we did have plenty of windows. The bathroom is not great- the shower nozzle sprayed in various directions and the pressure was minimal. The fold out couch for the kids was made up upside down so the steel rungs were poking into them until we realized and remade it the right way up. Also when we requested more blankets there were none to be had. We were only given 3 towels for 4 of us. It was a good set-up for our young children though as they had a tv and we had one in our room too. This was handy for some down time in the evenings and to keep them quiet in the morning. Having a washer/ dryer in the kitchen was very handy. Reception staff were ok- although our booking was meant to include a free breakfast box and drink vouchers and this wasn't included. All in all ,it was just ok. I will try another property next time.
reviews.title: Just okay.

likes.liked: — The apartment set-up was good with young kids.

reviews.text: I booked this apartment after having read the reviews on tripadvisor. It is now called the Mantra 100 Exhibition. We booked a 2 bedroom apartment for 2 couples. We stayed on the 3rd floor. The accommodation was nice enough but only had 1 sofa and one chair, not enough for 4 people! The photos of the property on the website are also very deceptive as our apartment was nowhere near as large as the photos depicted! Also the chairs in the downstairs lobby are white not red as depicted in photographs! Not a big deal of course but shows you that these pictures are clearly not recent!
reviews.title: More Clinical than a Hospital!!!

likes.disliked: — Overpriced services eg. breakfast, parking, internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one and only bathroom in the apartment was quite small and as another reviewer wrote the shower splashed water pretty much everywhere except in the bath! The bathroom and both bedrooms had no windows.
reviews.title: Loved the apartment

reviews.text: The kitchen had lots of storage however the cleaning of it left a bit to be desired as we found dirty (I mean REALLY filthy) cutlery put into the kitchen drawer along with clean cutlery. Not nice!
reviews.title: Well placed in CBD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 2 bedrooms each housed a queen bed but there was no room for anything else. The beds were comfortable and the pillows perfectly adequate - I did not see anywhere a choice of pillows as indicated by another reviewer so I believe that may not be offered anymore.
reviews.title: Pretty impressive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at around 10.30am and were kindly allowed to check in immediately upon arrival. The rooms are plain but contemporary and comfortable. Furnishings are of an average or standard quality. As with most apartment style accomodation, the space is terrific and makes the idea of a small hotel room unappealing. At Pacific International on Exhibition, the lounge room is all glass at one end, overlooking Exhibition Street. The internal bedroom is separated from the living space by a part glass partition and sliding door. The bathroom is large, but poorly designed with a shower over the bath and no hand towel rack adjacent to the basin. Speaking of design, there was a lot of white noise in our room from the plumbing and ventilation systems in the building. There were the usual niceties including a small breakfast pack, cooking utensils etc. If you like to self-cater, the kitchen would be challenging. However if you like to prepare breakfasts and/or lunches then it is ideal. There is no mini bar, which I find appealing. In this particular apartment the laundry had been removed. This posed no problem for me as my stay was only for two days, however others may expect a laundry and be disappointed. On the plus side there was pay TV and a small stereo. This proved to be a problem for our neighbours who played 'doof doof' music for some time until we complained to reception. The complaint was dealt with quickly and effectively with management reporting back to us what action they had taken and asking us to keep them informed if the situation did not improve. Top marks for this. Room service too was good and prompt. I surmised that the food is pre-prepared and frozen, however it was very tasty and reasonably priced. Our room was serviced, bed made and dishes washed. All of this was good although I felt that the house-keeping was just good enough and that the property did not sparkle. For example there was still construction dust or similar in the kitchen cupboards, windows were not clean, wardrobe door tracks dirty... that sort of thing. The things that matter were clean, but it could be better. In summary, this accomodation is well situated and good value. The staff were all friendly and efficient. I have stayed at numerous other establishments in Melbourne and have no hesitation in saying that this is one of the better ones. Recommended.
reviews.title: Great space

reviews.text: We chose Pacific apartments on Exhibition on the location and also based on the previous reviews.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose a one bedroom and was satisfied with the space and pleased with the large window that let in lots of natural light.
reviews.title: A good option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was fairly clean although it looked a little tired in places.
reviews.title: Value for money apartments located good proximity to all the tourist hotspots

reviews.text: The room didn't have much atmosphere and felt quite sterile however we found it to be quiet at night and the queen size bed comfortable.
reviews.title: Not a Bad option!!

likes.disliked: — The hotel could do with a clean

reviews.text: Setting up the broadband access was a tad confusing and the online help spoke to my wife like she was an idiot.
reviews.title: Wonderful - above expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for the Melbourne Grand Prix 2007 rooms were twice their normal price but we thought still pretty good value. Large open plan living room and dining room with all you could want and big bedroom and bathroom. Good location for the free tourist bus. Not far to anywhere. Very close to china town and I ate one of the best meals I have ever had in Ants.
reviews.title: Grand Prix Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My other half and I spent four nights at this hotel in August and while it was perfectly nice, we felt that the building and staff were a little clinical and sterile, making us feel one of a million visitors, rather than one in a million! We were probably spoiled having just left the most friendly accomodation ever in Cairns but still, the staff were functional but not really friendly. The room was clean and tidy but not especially comfortable or welcoming.
reviews.title: Nice, clean if a little sterile.

likes.liked: — very quiet, spacious room, good room service
likes.disliked: — clinical staff and surroundings, more suited to business travellers than tourists.

reviews.text: Good points: nice comfortable bed, lovely big windows so plenty of light and a decent enough view. Room service (from an outside catering company) was brilliant, delicious food and very good value. I'd highly recommend this.
reviews.title: Impressed and will return to stay here again

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, location, quality of furnishing, kitchenette

reviews.text: Bad points: clinical staff, minimalist style decor, no bath plug (despite asking for one every day for four days) and badly designed shower/bath combo leading to wet floor. Also the location of the hotel, while handy for Flinders Station etc was a bit isolated, especially in the evening when we found we had to walk quite a distance to get something to eat.
reviews.title: Everything you need!

likes.liked: — Spacious and fully self-contained. Cheap room service menu!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had just returned from a week's stay at Melbourne. I booked in to Pacific Intl on Exhibition for its proximity to CBD and Chinatown.
reviews.title: Great value, Great location

likes.liked: — Convenience to the city and cleanliness

reviews.text: Our family of 2 adults and 3 young children stayed here for 3 nights in a 2 br apartment during the Australian Open Tennis. We booked about 10 days ahead and secured a room for $309/night, the hotel matching an advertised internet rate.
reviews.title: Apartments with an Office Feel
